meanings.definition: The act of hunting or catching birds.
meanings.sent1: Fowling is a popular pastime for many nature enthusiasts.
meanings.sent2: The ancient art of fowling has been practiced for centuries.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa always tells stories about his fowling adventures in the woods.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet marsh, the heron engaged in a graceful dance of fowling.
meanings.sent5: The children were mesmerized by the skilled fowling techniques of the falconer.

meanings.definition: The sport or practice of hunting birds.
meanings.sent1: Many people enjoy the competitive aspect of fowling as a sport.
meanings.sent2: Fowling requires patience, skill, and a deep connection to nature.
meanings.sent3: The annual fowling competition always draws a large crowd of spectators.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to fowling earned him the title of champion hunter.
meanings.sent5: The art of fowling is not just about the hunt but also about respect for the birds.

meanings.definition: The act of shooting birds for sport or food.
meanings.sent1: Some communities rely on fowling as a source of food during harsh winters.
meanings.sent2: Fowling can be a way to provide sustenance for families in rural areas.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared a delicious meal using the fowling skills he learned as a child.
meanings.sent4: The tradition of fowling has been passed down through generations in this village.
meanings.sent5: The sound of fowling echoed through the valley as the hunters set out at dawn.
